channel.title: Posts on The Miette
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on The Miette

item.title: July 2022 Build Update
item.description: A July build update What have we done? Absolutely nothing. Lys honestly thinks it’s been the wettest July that we’ve lived through in sunny Australia. Table Of Contents What we’ve done Challenges What’s next? What we’ve done Erny jetted off to the US for a few weeks to play ultimate frisbee! Left to her own devices Lys did a few sundry things like source suppliers for our metal connectors. We’ve also added a few new features to the site - like comments and you can now subscribe if you feel so inclined.

item.title: A Quick Trip to Canberra
item.description: A quick trip to Canberra In January we sped down to Canberra to pick up some double glazed glass for our windows. We had been on the hunt for double glazed glass closer to home but it seems that Canberra - having cold winters - has great reclaimed glass options. Table Of Contents Introducing Handyman Trading Post A side step antiquing So what’d you get? But why use double glazing?

item.title: June 2022 Build Update
item.description: A June build update Decided that we should do monthly build updates as we march towards the end of the year. We’re hoping to reach lock up by then (walls, floor and roof complete) and 31st December is our D-day. Table Of Contents What we’ve done Challenges What’s next? What we’ve done Erny bought a second hand table saw for $400 a few months back and it’s been an absolute workhorse.

item.title: Hi I'm Miette
item.description: Hello World ðŸ‘‹ My name is Lys and my partner Erny and I are building a tiny home made out of seconds, reclaimed and recycled materials. This is a small space on the interwebs to to document our progress and share our photos for anyone who would like to follow our journey! ðŸ˜„ Table Of Contents Why build a tiny house? Do you have any constraints? What does miette mean? So how’s it going?
